intro: Duguetia pycnastera, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It produces small, round berries that are edible and often consumed by various wildlife species. Duguetia pycnastera plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for numerous animals.
